title: ‚ÄòNeoliberal and Authoritarian‚Äô? A Simplistic Analysis of the Maduro Government that Leaves Much Unsaid
content: Political analyst Steve Ellner dissects Gabriel Hetland‚Äôs simplistic critique of the Maduro government in Venezuela.
resumen: Gabriel Hetland‚Äôs article ‚ÄúCapitalism and authoritarianism in Maduro‚Äôs Venezuela,‚Äù presents a one-sided and decontextualised view of Venezuela under President Nicol√°s Maduro. Hetland refers approvingly to the claim made by Maduro‚Äôs harshest critics on the left, that his government and the right-wing opposition are ‚Äútwo sides of the same coin‚Äù. Any serious examination of Venezuela under Maduro needs to incorporate the impact of US-imposed economic sanctions into its analysis. The Washington-engineered economic war significantly undermined the effectiveness of potentially sound policies initiated by Maduro. Hetland‚Äôs black-and-white approach does a disservice to the complex and, in many respects, unique experience of Chavismo. The illegal and semi-legal actions undertaken by Washington and Venezuela‚Äôs right-wing opposition have been numerous and relentless almost since the start of the Hugo Ch√°vez presidency in 1999, including: abortive coups; assassination attempts; recognition of de facto governments; open appeals by top US officials urging Venezuelan military officers to intervene; invasions by paramilitary forces from Colombia; covert and public international campaigns to isolate Venezuela; foreign funding of opposition groups; widespread and protracted street violence aimed at regime change; and sweeping secondary sanctions. The full scope of the war on Venezuela has to be brought into the picture. The impacts of the war on Venezuela are an essential element in the debate over whether the Maduro presidency should be deemed an outright failure. These Maduro critics underestimate the devastating effect of the war on Venezuela, especially given that Maduro‚Äôs errors were, in many cases, overreactions to Washington-backed provocations. Washington has systematically countered every initiative undertaken by the Maduro government to address economic difficulties facing the nation. In August 2017 US President Donald Trump prohibited the trading of Venezuelan bonds in US markets. Trump issued an executive order in 2018 banning the purchase of Venezuelan gold. The Maduro government launched a crypto currency, the Petro, to bypass the US-controlled SWIFT system. Trump responded with another executive order prohibiting the use of Petros under US jurisdiction. The second Trump administration has refused to renew ‚Äúlicenses‚Äù the Biden administration granted Chevron and other corporations to operate in Venezuela. Maduro‚Äôs rapprochement with the private sector should be debated. Hetland acknowledges prevailing conditions did not allow Maduro to advance toward a ‚Äúsocialist transformation.‚Äù Maduro, in his 2025 annual Speech to the Nation announced that 85% of the food sold in supermarkets is now ‚ÄúMade in Venezuela.‚Äù A rigorous critical analysis would acknowledge Maduro‚Äôs claims and present empirical evidence to challenge them, or identify specific shortcomings in the implementation of developmentalism. Hetland makes no reference to the government-promoted communes. Chris Gilbert explores this revitalisation in Commune or Nothing! Venezuela‚Äôs Communal Movement and its Socialist Project. The experience of Prado and the communes is clearly at odds with Hetland‚Äôs interpretation of the Venezuelan government under Maduro. Hetland makes no mention of critical supporters among writers and political figures, Venezuelans and non-Venezuelans, but refers extensively to the recently formed group Comunes. In his discussion of the protests that followed the July 28, 2024 presidential elections, Hetland fails to take into account a viewpoint on the left that runs counter to his own. Attorney General Tarek William Saab presented extensive evidence alleging that on those two days delinquents, in cahoots with the Venezuelan right, carried out attacks on symbols of the state. Hetland‚Äôs lack of objectivity is his accusation that I justify political repression in Venezuela. I wrote: ‚ÄúSome left analysts fault Maduro for taking off the gloves and not abiding by the norms of liberal democracy. In some cases, the criticisms are valid but they have to be contextualised.‚Äù Hetland‚Äôs portrayal of my views reflect a broader trend in writing on the left that polarises discussion on the Venezuelan government ‚Äî in which Maduro is either demonised or viewed uncritically. Hetland attempts to refute my central arguments by labelling the Maduro government anti-working class and corrupt. The ‚Äúcaveats‚Äù in my writing on Venezuela that he ignores include my critique of Maduro ‚Äî and, to a lesser extent, Ch√°vez ‚Äî for failing to seize favourable moments to deepen the transformation process and deliver decisive blows against corruption. The tensions between Maduro and the PCV were initially of a ‚Äúsecondary‚Äù nature, and Maduro‚Äôs sectarianism contributed to the eventual rupture. The errors and shortcomings of the Maduro government cannot be pushed under the carpet or justified, but they nevertheless must be understood in context. There is a direct correlation between the intensity of imperialist aggression and the ability of a government committed to real change to achieve its social, political and economic goals. Ch√°vez recognized early in his rule that forging alliances with business sectors was necessary to offset the aggression waged by domestic and foreign adversaries. Criticism that identifies the downsides of the policies of the Venezuelan government and defines political opportunities has been essential. The challenges faced by Maduro are in many ways greater than those Ch√°vez encountered, at least in the years following the regime change attempts of 2002-03. These included the plummeting of oil prices (beginning in 2015), Obama‚Äôs 2015 executive order, and the erosion of public enthusiasm.

title: Rumor: La producci√≥n del Nissan Sentra se podr√≠a mudar a EE.UU.
content: Un proveedor de la marca japonesa habl√≥ sobre un posible movimiento para evitar los aranceles de Donald Trump, y te contamos todos los detalles.
resumen: Un proveedor de la marca japonesa habl√≥ sobre un posible movimiento para evitar los aranceles de Donald Trump. El Nissan Sentra es uno de los modelos m√°s importantes de la marca japonesa en Estados Unidos, siendo actualmente el segundo veh√≠culo m√°s vendido por la marca en aquel mercado, detr√°s del Rogue/X-Trail. En lo que va del a√±o, se vendieron m√°s de 54.000 unidades del Sentra, que representa un 34% m√°s que en el mismo periodo del a√±o pasado. El Presidente de EE.UU impuso un 25% de aranceles para los veh√≠culos importados. La marca japonesa estar√≠a evaluando mudar la producci√≥n de M√©xico a EE.UU. Un proveedor de Nissan filtr√≥ que la marca est√° considerando seriamente mover la producci√≥n del Sentra a su planta en Canton, Mississippi, donde actualmente produce el Altima y la Frontier (estadounidense), pero opera por debajo de su capacidad. Para los pa√≠ses que ten√≠an tratado de libre comercio con M√©xico pero no con EE.UU, como Argentina, el Sentra pasar√° a pagar m√°s aranceles; en el caso de Argentina, del 35%. Nissan est√° preparando la nueva generaci√≥n del Sentra, que deber√≠a debutar este a√±o.

resumen:
*   **ISRAEL PALESTINA:** Naciones Unidas ha logrado permiso de las autoridades israel√≠es para que hasta un centenar de camiones con ayuda humanitaria entren en la Franja de Gaza despu√©s de m√°s de dos meses de bloqueo, mientras algunos l√≠deres europeos amenazan ya con tomar medidas contra Israel si no detiene sus sangrientos ataques en el enclave palestino. Se ha enviado informaci√≥n sobre las negociaciones en Doha, donde el primer ministro y canciller de Catar, Mohamed bin Abdulrahm√°n, acus√≥ este martes a Israel de "abortar las posibilidades" para una tregua en Gaza, y de que hay una "brecha fundamental" entre Israel y Ham√°s: tregua parcial o integral.
*   **UCRANIA GUERRA:** El presidente ucraniano, Volod√≠mir Zelenski, dijo este martes que es "obvio que Rusia trata de ganar tiempo para continuar la guerra y la ocupaci√≥n" en Ucrania, un nuevo jarro de agua fr√≠a a la iniciativa diplom√°tica emprendida este lunes por el presidente de Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, para intentar que las partes negocien un alto el fuego. Con motivo del tercer aniversario de la rendici√≥n ucraniana en la acerer√≠a de Azvostal en Mari√∫pol, decenas de familiares de los soldados capturados entonces se manifestaron este martes en Kiev para exigir su inclusi√≥n en el canje de mil prisioneros de cada bando acordado por las delegaciones de Ucrania y Rusia el viernes pasado en Estambul. Los primeros pasos del papa Le√≥n XIV sobre la guerra en Ucrania despiertan optimismo en el pa√≠s, que ve en el Vaticano un aliado clave en un momento en el que Kiev lucha por reforzar la presi√≥n internacional contra Mosc√∫ para que detenga la invasi√≥n. El Consejo de la Uni√≥n Europea aprob√≥ este martes el decimos√©ptimo paquete de sanciones contra Rusia desde su invasi√≥n de Ucrania en febrero de 2022, que vuelve a tener como objetivo a los barcos que clandestinamente ayudan a eludir las restricciones contra el petr√≥leo ruso.
*   **EEUU PRESUPUESTOS:** El presidente de EE.UU., Donald Trump, asiste a la conferencia del Partido Republicano en la C√°mara de Representantes, mientras su formaci√≥n avanza en su pol√©mico plan de recortes presupuestarios y rebajas fiscales que ha encontrado oposici√≥n interna por considerar que aumentar√≠a el d√©ficit.
*   **ESPA√ëA MIGRACI√ìN:** Espa√±a estrena este martes una reforma en el reglamento de Extranjer√≠a que pretende simplificar el acceso a permisos de residencia y regularizar a unas 900.000 personas en tres a√±os, aunque organizaciones civiles alertan de que puede impactar en la p√©rdida de derechos de algunos colectivos.
*   **TRATADO PANDEMIAS:** Los pa√≠ses miembros de la Organizaci√≥n Mundial de la Salud (OMS) adoptaron este martes el Tratado Global sobre Pandemias, un hist√≥rico acuerdo que ofrece al mundo las herramientas para prevenir, prepararse y responder a una pr√≥xima pandemia, que la comunidad cient√≠fica asegura que ocurrir√° en alg√∫n momento.
*   **COLOMBIA REFORMAS:** El presidente de Colombia, Gustavo Petro, encabeza en Barranquilla una reuni√≥n con organizaciones sociales y sindicales para decidir si convocan un paro nacional, tras el rechazo en el Senado de la consulta popular con la que el Gobierno buscaba impulsar la reforma laboral.

*   **MARADONA JUICIO:** El juicio por la muerte de Diego Armando Maradona tiene previsto continuar este martes con el testimonio del psic√≥logo del √≠dolo argentino, el imputado Carlos D√≠az, y de dos acompa√±antes terap√©uticos, aunque se prev√© que la audiencia se centre en un nuevo pedido de recusaci√≥n de la jueza Julieta Makintach por un supuesto conflicto de intereses.
*   **PEPE MUJICA:** Una semana despu√©s de su fallecimiento, la izquierda uruguaya recuerda al expresidente Jos√© Mujica, quien esta martes celebrar√≠a 90 a√±os.

title: China‚Äôs Effort to Build a Competitor to Starlink Is Off to a Bumpy Start
content: China has launched over 100 satellites for two broadband networks that could eventually rival the service from Elon Musk's SpaceX, but progress is hampered by launch bottlenecks and high failure rates ...
resumen:
China has launched over 100 satellites for two broadband networks that could rival Elon Musk's SpaceX.

The two Chinese projects are Guowang and Qianfan, aiming to have about 28,000 satellites combined when completed.

Guowang (Xingwang or SatNet) focuses on domestic telecommunications and national security.

Qianfan (Spacesail or SSST) is oriented toward providing service to foreign telecom companies and has signed deals with Brazil, Malaysia, and Thailand.

Qianfan has launched 90 satellites, and Guowang has launched 29.

Qianfan is grappling with a high rate of possible faulty satellites.

Jonathan McDowell says that, of the 90 satellites that Qianfan has launched, 13 seem to have exhibited irregular behavior.

Starlink started with about a 3 percent failure rate, it has since gone down to less than 0.5 percent, according to McDowell‚Äôs data.

Qianfan and Guowang have opted to put their satellites in higher orbits than Starlink.

Guowang wants to have nearly 13,000 satellites in total, while Qianfan plans to have more than 15,000.

The ITU requires firms to launch their first satellite within seven years of reserving the spectrum, then steadily make progress toward completing their launches within seven years after that.

The ITU rules state they will need to have sent 10 percent of their spacecraft into the sky by 2026.

Guowang registered with the ITU in 2020.

Qianfan has state backing from Shanghai‚Äôs municipal government.

China still doesn‚Äôt have any operable reusable rockets yet.

Qianfan has put out two public procurement requests this year for rocket suppliers but declared them both failures.

Guowang could be tasked with use cases that have a national security element.

Qianfan is positioning itself as a competitor to Starlink for the international market.

Qianfan representatives presented at a space industry conference in China last year showed it‚Äôs already working in six markets: Brazil, Kazakhstan, Malaysia, Oman, Pakistan, and Uzbekistan.

Qianfan is providing only local telecom companies with satellite internet capabilities.

title: El metal busca nuevos mercados en el golfo P√©rsico y el sudeste asi√°tico
content: 'La calidad siempre nos ha permitido salir adelante', asevera el director general del Banco Sabadell ante los aranceles de Trump ...
resumen: Los pa√≠ses del golfo P√©rsico y del sudeste asi√°tico se han convertido en un polo de atracci√≥n para las empresas asturianas, especialmente las del metal, que sustentan la industria de la comarca avilesina. Se trata de destinos que cobran fuerza para la exportaci√≥n de bienes de equipo ante las dificultades que suponen los aranceles impuestos por Donald Trump, y que afectan a las firmas asturianas de manera indirecta, por su repercusi√≥n sobre otros pa√≠ses europeos que son clientes tradicionales de las compa√±√≠as del Principado. El nuevo contexto del mercado mundial fue analizado en el Espacio Portus, el centro de interpretaci√≥n del Puerto de Avil√©s, en el transcurso del acto titulado "Jornada de negocio internacional: situaci√≥n arancelaria en el contexto geopol√≠tico actual", organizada por el Banco Sabadell y las c√°maras de comercio de Avil√©s, Oviedo y Gij√≥n. Daniel Gonz√°lez, presidente de la C√°mara de Comercio de Avil√©s, y Santiago Rodr√≠guez Vega, presidente de la Autoridad Portuaria, dieron la bienvenida al Espacio Portus a los presentes. Pablo Junceda, director general del Banco Sabadell Herrero, destac√≥ c√≥mo y cu√°nto "las decisiones pol√≠ticas acaban afectando a los empresarios, que son los que crean empleo, riqueza y pagan impuestos". Carlos Arola, del grupo gestor de mercanc√≠as Arola, explic√≥ el complicado momento que atraviesa el comercio internacional y las diferentes posibilidades legales que tienen las empresas para, al menos, minorar el impacto arancelario de Estados Unidos. Advirti√≥ de lo complejo y volatil del sistema log√≠stico, adelantando un incremento de los fletes de entre el 15 y el 20% hasta final de a√±o. Bruno L√≥pez, director general de Asturex, resumi√≥ las conclusiones de la reuni√≥n que mantuvieron el pasado lunes las comunidades aut√≥nomas con el ministro de Econom√≠a, Comercio y Empresa, Carlos Cuerpo, en el que les expuso la situaci√≥n que se est√° produciendo a nivel global y las negociaciones y medidas que estudia la Comisi√≥n Europea. Estados Unidos representa un 4% del total de las exportaciones asturianas, algo m√°s de 200 millones de euros. La mitad de esa cuant√≠a corresponde a la avilesina Windar Renovables. La industria asturiana est√° integrada en la cadena de valor en la que su principal cliente es Europa, y especialmente Alemania, Francia, Italia y Portugal. Las exportaciones industriales asturianas retrocedieron el 40% arrastradas por la mala situaci√≥n econ√≥mica alemana. Asturex apenas recibe consultas sobre los aranceles. Mercosur es "muy importante por el n√∫mero de habitantes", y que M√©xico y Chile tambi√©n son buenos destinos. Las empresas del metal tienen claros sus objetivos, y son aquellos pa√≠ses en los que se est√°n realizando fuertes inversiones como Arabia Saud√≠, Catar, Bar√©in, Emiratos √Årabes y Om√°n. Sin dejar de lado otros como Singapur, Indonesia e India.

title: El Salvador en pl√°ticas con Estados Unidos por arancel a las importaciones
content: El Ministerio de Econom√≠a dijo que ha sostenido encuentros con funcionarios de Estados Unidos para abordar el tema. El arancel a El Salvador es de un 10%.
resumen: El Ministerio de Econom√≠a dijo que ha sostenido encuentros con funcionarios de Estados Unidos para abordar el tema. El arancel a El Salvador es de un 10%. La ministra de Econom√≠a, Mar√≠a Luisa Hayem, asegur√≥ que el tema de los aranceles impuestos por Estados Unidos ‚Äúya est√° encaminado‚Äù. La funcionaria indic√≥ que se reuni√≥ con el secretario de Comercio de Estados Unidos, Howard Lutnick, y con la Agencia de Comercio y Desarrollo de los Estados Unidos (USTDA) y uno de los temas abordados fue el de las tarifas. El Salvador fue incluido en una lista de 90 pa√≠ses a los que Estados Unidos impuso un arancel del 10%. La reuni√≥n surgi√≥ luego del encuentro entre los presidentes Nayib Bukele y Donald Trump, el pasado 15 de abril. Hayem dijo, en una entrevista televisiva el pasado 5 de mayo, que las tarifas han sido establecidas de manera universal a la gran mayor√≠a de pa√≠ses del mundo y que El Salvador tiene una de las tasas preferenciales. ‚ÄúEl Salvador es uno de los privilegiados con la tarifa m√°s baja que se ha establecido(...) Ese es un trabajo t√©cnico que est√° encaminado, con una gran apertura para poder dialogar‚Äù, dijo la funcionaria. La ministra afirm√≥ que El Salvador cuenta con una relaci√≥n cada vez m√°s fortalecida con Estados Unidos, ‚Äúel principal destino de nuestras exportaciones‚Äù y proveedor de materias primas. Seg√∫n los datos del Banco Central de Reserva (BCR) en el primer trimestre del a√±o llegaron a los $1,681.3 millones, un 8.8% m√°s en comparaci√≥n con el mismo periodo de 2024. Las venta hacia Estados Unidos, bajaron 4.9%. El presidente Trump dijo que impondr√≠a tasas arancelarias elevadas a naciones que tienen super√°vits comerciales con Estados Unidos, al tiempo que impon√≠a un arancel base del 10% sobre las importaciones de todos los pa√≠ses en respuesta a lo que llam√≥ una emergencia econ√≥mica. ‚ÄúLa buena noticia es que en las conversaciones que ha tenido el Gobierno de El Salvador y el de Estados Unidos, especialmente en la parte de comercio, hay perspectivas positivas de que ese arancel pueda, si no eliminarse totalmente, al menos disminuirse en un buen porcentaje de nuestras exportaciones‚Äù, declar√≥ Jorge Arriaza, presidente de la Asociaci√≥n Salvadore√±a de Industriales (ASI). Arriaza confirm√≥ que el arancel del 10% ya se est√° aplicando a El Salvador y que se ha traducido en un incremento en el precio de los bienes que env√≠an a la naci√≥n norteamericana. Por su parte, Leticia Escobar, presidenta de la C√°mara de Comercio e Industria de El Salvador (CAMARASAL), se√±al√≥ que si bien, los aranceles afectan a las empresas salvadore√±as, como gremial lo est√°n viendo como una oportunidad. ‚ÄúAl diversificar los mercados, tenemos una mayor cantidad de clientes potenciales a los cuales exportar. Como C√°mara siempre estamos apoyando a los empresarios a encontrar los mecanismos que los ayuden a ser m√°s competitivos y encontrar estos nuevos nichos‚Äù, declar√≥ Escobar en la entrevista Di√°logo 21.

resumen: La Entidad Binacional de Yacyret√° (EBY) recibir√° entre 100 y 150 millones de d√≥lares adicionales. Paraguay y Argentina firmaron un acuerdo que establece nuevos precios a la energ√≠a generada por esta hidroel√©ctrica. Cada pa√≠s pagar√° 28 d√≥lares por megavatios por hora. El nuevo convenio permitir√° ¬´el reinicio de la obra¬ª en el brazo A√±a Cu√° del r√≠o Paran√° y va ¬´a inyectar unos 250 megavatios¬ª a la generaci√≥n de Yacyret√°. title: Unos 6 millones de registros fueron extra√≠dos tras ciberataque a 18 entidades paraguayas
content: Asunci√≥n, 20 may (EFE).- Unos 6 millones de registros con informaci√≥n personal de vacunaci√≥n y registros de proveedores fueron extra√≠dos por piratas inform√°ticos tras los "ataques cibern√©ticos" sufrid ...
resumen:
Unos 6 millones de registros con informaci√≥n personal de vacunaci√≥n y registros de proveedores fueron extra√≠dos por piratas inform√°ticos tras los ¬´ataques cibern√©ticos¬ª sufridos por los sitios web de 18 entidades de Paraguay, seg√∫n fuentes del Ministerio de Tecnolog√≠as de la Informaci√≥n y Comunicaci√≥n (Mitic).

La ¬´exfiltraci√≥n (robo) de datos¬ª en los ministerios de Salud P√∫blica y Bienestar Social y de Agricultura y Ganader√≠a se constat√≥ a partir del pasado 9 de mayo, dijo el director general de Ciberseguridad y Protecci√≥n de la Informaci√≥n del Mitic, Pedro Mart√≠nez.

Los datos corresponden a informaci√≥n personal como nombre, apellido, direcci√≥n o correos proveniente de un ¬´sistema de vacunaci√≥n¬ª administrado por el Ministerio de Salud.

En el Ministerio de Agricultura hubo otra exfiltraci√≥n de documentos que contienen informaci√≥n ¬´societaria¬ª sobre ¬´algunos proveedores¬ª.

En otras 13 p√°ginas del Gobierno paraguayo se detect√≥ un ¬´defacement¬ª o desfiguraci√≥n, un tipo de ataque que reemplaza datos de las webs, y en tres casos un ¬´acceso no autorizado¬ª a los sitios web.

Entre los afectados mencion√≥ las p√°ginas del Gabinete Civil de la Presidencia de la Rep√∫blica, el Gabinete Militar, la C√°mara de Diputados, la Administraci√≥n Nacional de Navegaci√≥n y Puertos, la Direcci√≥n de Meteorolog√≠a e Hidrolog√≠a, la Municipalidad de la ciudad de Pilar (sur), el Servicio Nacional de Catastro, la Caja de Jubilados y Pensionados del Personal Municipal.

Adem√°s, los ministerios de Educaci√≥n y Ciencia, Justicia, Ni√±ez y Adolescencia, Trabajo; y las secretar√≠as Anticorrupci√≥n, de Desarrollo para Repatriados, de Deportes, y de Administraci√≥n de Bienes Incautados (Senabico).

El Mitic present√≥ este lunes una denuncia penal ante una Unidad Especializada en Delitos Inform√°ticos del Ministerio P√∫blico ¬´por ataques cibern√©ticos contra instituciones del Estado¬ª.

Los hechos denunciados incluyen ¬´accesos no autorizados a servidores, interrupciones en servicios p√∫blicos digitales, sustracci√≥n y difusi√≥n de datos sensibles, y actividades maliciosas originadas desde el extranjero¬ª.

El actor ¬´principal¬ª que se atribuy√≥ el ataque a trav√©s de publicaciones en redes sociales ¬´se hace llamar Cyber Team¬ª, que es un grupo ¬´hacktivista¬ª, adem√°s de otro usuario ‚Äúparticular‚Äù que no identific√≥.

title: Wall Street cierra en rojo y el S&P 500 rompe racha de seis sesiones consecutivas al alza
content: A pesar de las p√©rdidas para el S&P 500, el selectivo ha subido m√°s del 20% desde que tocara su m√≠nimo en abril.
resumen: Wall Street cerr√≥ este martes en rojo y el selectivo S&P 500 rompi√≥ as√≠ su racha de seis sesiones consecutivas al alza. Al toque de campana, el Dow Jones de Industriales perdi√≥ un 0,27% hasta los 42.677 puntos, el S&P 500 cay√≥ un 0,39% hasta los 5.940 enteros y el tecnol√≥gico Nasdaq retrocedi√≥ un 0,38% hasta las 19.142 unidades. El S&P 500 ha subido m√°s del 20% desde que tocara su m√≠nimo en abril y ahora se encuentra a aproximadamente un 3% de su m√°ximo hist√≥rico. Las acciones de Tesla subieron (0,51%). Retrocedieron los principales valores tecnol√≥gicos, como Nvidia (-0,88%), Meta (-0,52%), Amazon (-1%), Apple (-0,92%) y Microsoft (-0,15 %). Entre las 30 mayores cotizadas del Dow Jones, subieron UnitedHealth Group (1,8 %), Boeing (1,18 %) y Merck (0,96%) y tambi√©n cayeron American Express (-1,05%), Goldman Sachs (-0,94%) y Chevron (-0,88%).

title: Exportaciones de iPhone desde China a EE.UU. caen 72% y Apple lanza agresivos descuentos
content: Apple ha intensificado su producci√≥n en India, mientras el presidente de los Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, critica esta estrategia. Las ca√≠das de exportaci√≥n reflejan la fragilidad de las cadenas de s ...
resumen: Las exportaciones de iPhone y otros dispositivos m√≥viles fabricados en China cayeron 72% en abril, alcanzando su nivel m√°s bajo desde 2011, sumando apenas US$700 millones, en medio de una creciente tensi√≥n comercial entre China y Estados Unidos. Esta ca√≠da supera el descenso general del 21% en las exportaciones chinas hacia EE.UU. durante el mismo mes. El comercio total entre ambos pa√≠ses alcanz√≥ los US$690.000 millones en 2024. Apple enfrenta dificultades en China, con una ca√≠da del 9% en sus env√≠os de smartphones en el primer trimestre de 2025. Para revertir esta tendencia, Apple y plataformas de comercio electr√≥nico como JD.com y Tmall lanzaron descuentos agresivos sobre los modelos iPhone 16, con rebajas de hasta 2.530 yuanes (US$351). JD.com vende el iPhone 16 Pro de 128GB a 5.469 yuanes (US$760), cuando el precio oficial de Apple es de 7.999 yuanes (US$1.110). Tmall ofrece el mismo modelo a 5.499 yuanes. Las autoridades chinas han incluido a los smartphones en su plan de est√≠mulo al consumo, con subsidios de hasta 500 yuanes (US$70) para modelos de menos de 6.000 yuanes (US$830). Apple ha intensificado el traslado de su producci√≥n a India. El presidente Donald Trump ha criticado esta estrategia.

title: Coyuntura. Entre los vaivenes nacionales y la incertidumbre global
content: La volatilidad de la econom√≠a global en 2025 junto con la coexistencia de se√±ales contradictorias en la actividad a nivel pa√≠s perfilan un contexto desafiante, pero a√∫n as√≠ pueden encontrarse oportuni ...
resumen:
En 2025, la volatilidad de la econom√≠a global y las se√±ales contradictorias en la actividad a nivel pa√≠s perfilan un contexto desafiante, pero con oportunidades.

El mercado inmobiliario argentino busca se√±ales para la toma de decisiones. El sector inmobiliario regional (Argentina y Uruguay) sigue representando oportunidades estrat√©gicas de inversi√≥n.

En Argentina, el crecimiento econ√≥mico podr√≠a aumentar la demanda de propiedades residenciales, comerciales y tur√≠sticas. El retorno del cr√©dito bancario, seg√∫n Luis Signoris (gerente general de CGF), puede marcar una diferencia en el mercado de real estate argentino.

La inversi√≥n en real estate sigue siendo una forma segura de proteger el capital a nivel regional.

La construcci√≥n tuvo una ca√≠da del 27,4% durante 2024, afectando a empresas como FV.

La estabilidad pol√≠tica, leyes seguras y econom√≠as estables son fundamentales para atraer inversores extranjeros.

El cr√©dito est√° en auge, pasando del 4,4% del Producto Interno Bruto (PIB) al 7,5%, seg√∫n el Informe Monetario Mensual de febrero del Banco Central de la Rep√∫blica Argentina (BCRA). Se prev√© un crecimiento del PIB cercano al 5% este a√±o, seg√∫n el Banco Mundial. La desocupaci√≥n baj√≥ del 7,7% en el primer trimestre de 2024 al 6,4% en el cuarto trimestre de 2024, seg√∫n el Indec.

El acumulado de enero-abril de 2025 del √çndice Construya cerr√≥ 10,9% por encima del mismo per√≠odo del a√±o anterior.

Cr√©ditos prendarios a 5 a√±os, hipotecarios reactivados y l√≠neas productivas con tasas competitivas reflejan una nueva visi√≥n de los bancos.

Los datos del √çndice Construya mostraron un crecimiento mensual e interanual en el sector de la construcci√≥n. En abril pasado, la suba fue del 10,44% respecto de marzo en t√©rminos desestacionalizados.

Rodolfo Viegener (due√±o de la f√°brica de grifer√≠as Ferrum, del Grupo FV) afirm√≥ que su empresa se encuentra en una situaci√≥n complicada, atravesando una recesi√≥n. En mayo de 2024, la firma suspendi√≥ a 800 operarios de la planta de Pilar (provincia de Buenos Aires), donde trabajan 1.400 personas y se fabrican 3.500 art√≠culos.

La construcci√≥n tuvo una ca√≠da del 27,4% durante 2024. En abril pasado, el √çndice Construya (IC) registr√≥ una recuperaci√≥n de 10,44% mensual desestacionalizada, y en la comparaci√≥n interanual, una suba de 25,8%.

Rodolfo Viegener cuestion√≥ la importaci√≥n de productos desde China.

title: Gobierno de Trump reprocha a Costa Rica 6 barreras ‚Äòirritantes‚Äô al comercio; con√≥zcalas en detalle
content: Administraci√≥n de Donald Trump reprocha a Costa Rica barreras en bebidas alcoh√≥licas, licitaciones p√∫blicas e intercambio comercial de papas, entre otros productos.
resumen:
Estados Unidos reproch√≥ a Costa Rica seis barreras ‚Äúirritantes‚Äù en el comercio para los exportadores estadounidenses. La administraci√≥n de Donald Trump enumer√≥ los obst√°culos en el informe Estimaci√≥n Nacional de Comercio (NTE, por sus siglas en ingl√©s), d√≠as antes de imponer un 10% de arancel a los productos costarricenses.

1.  Impuestos a bebidas alcoh√≥licas: Costa Rica aplica un impuesto selectivo de consumo a las bebidas alcoh√≥licas destiladas, calculado como un porcentaje de alcohol por litro, con base en tres tasas espec√≠ficas. La tasa m√°s alta se aplica a las bebidas con m√°s de un 30% de alcohol por volumen, mientras que la mayor√≠a de las producidas por la estatal F√°brica Nacional de Licores (Fanal) se encuentran por debajo de este umbral, a diferencia de muchas importadas que lo superan. Los productores nacionales pueden pagar el impuesto dentro de los primeros 15 d√≠as de cada mes sobre las ventas realizadas durante el mes anterior, mientras que los importadores deben pagarlo antes de que su producto sea liberado de la aduana.
2.  Licitaciones p√∫blicas: Las empresas estadounidenses afrontan desventajas en las licitaciones p√∫blicas en Costa Rica al competir con empresas estatales costarricenses, especialmente en los sectores de tecnolog√≠as de la informaci√≥n, telecomunicaciones y seguros. El art√≠culo 2 de la Ley de Contrataci√≥n P√∫blica permite adjudicar contratos sin competencia a entidades p√∫blicas si los funcionarios certifican que la adjudicaci√≥n representa un uso eficiente de los fondos p√∫blicos.
3.  Barreras sanitarias y fitosanitarias: El Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganader√≠a (MAG) de Costa Rica retrasa ocasionalmente la emisi√≥n de permisos fitosanitarios de importaci√≥n para productos sensibles durante ciertas √©pocas del a√±o, como la temporada de cosecha, lo que afecta a los exportadores estadounidenses.
4.  Apertura en mercado de papas: El mercado costarricense para las papas de mesa estadounidenses ha estado cerrado desde el 2013. Estados Unidos export√≥ aproximadamente $3,4 millones en papas para fre√≠r a Costa Rica en el 2024; sin embargo, la industria estima que las exportaciones estadounidenses de papa podr√≠an aumentar a m√°s de $5 millones si se abordan los problemas fitosanitarios y se reabre el mercado de papa de mesa.
5.  Trabas a productos de origen animal: Una regulaci√≥n costarricense del 2016 exige extensos cuestionarios a ciertas instalaciones que exportan productos animales a Costa Rica, como l√°cteos, mariscos, ovejas y huevos. Las exportaciones estadounidenses de estos productos enfrentan retrasos de varios meses o m√°s al introducir nuevos productos en el mercado costarricense.
6.  Propiedad intelectual: Costa Rica debe demostrar, mediante informes, la eficacia de los nuevos programas para rastrear el uso de software sin licencia del sistema de registro en l√≠nea, a fin de mejorar el control fronterizo. Adem√°s, Estados Unidos insiste en que Costa Rica refuerce la protecci√≥n de la propiedad intelectual para frenar la pirater√≠a en l√≠nea y agilizar los procedimientos aduaneros que buscan disuadir la entrada de productos falsificados y pirateados.

La Oficina del Representante Comercial de los Estados Unidos (USTR) present√≥ un informe en donde detalla las barreras comerciales que enfrentan los exportadores estadounidenses. El ministro de Comercio Exterior (Comex), Manuel Tovar, dijo que se trata de temas ‚Äúirritantes‚Äù para el pa√≠s norteamericano. Estos se√±alamientos forman parte de la mesa t√©cnica de negociaci√≥n entre ambos pa√≠ses, instalada la semana pasada en Washington, donde Costa Rica busca suspender el arancel del 10 % a sus exportaciones. En el 2024, Costa Rica coloc√≥ un total de $9.411,9 millones en EE. UU., lo que representa el 47% de los $19.900 millones destinados al mercado exterior, seg√∫n datos de la Promotora de Comercio Exterior (Procomer). Adem√°s, la naci√≥n norteamericana aport√≥ el 70% del flujo de inversi√≥n extranjera el a√±o pasado, equivalente a $3.047,5 millones, de acuerdo a datos del Banco Central de Costa Rica (BCCR).

title: Global Economic Officials Gather Amid Headwinds From Trump‚Äôs Trade War
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will meet his international counterparts at a G7 finance ministers meeting in Canada.
resumen: Top finance officials from the world‚Äôs wealthiest economies began gathering in Canada on Tuesday for meetings. The summit of the Group of 7 finance ministers is likely to be more fraught this year. The tariffs that Mr. Trump has imposed on American allies and adversaries have threatened to blunt global growth and inflame inflation. Europe, Japan and Canada have all been bearing the brunt of the Trump administration‚Äôs ‚ÄúAmerica First‚Äù economic agenda. The three days of meetings will include support for Ukraine, concerns about China‚Äôs economic practices and headwinds facing the global economy. Mr. Trump‚Äôs trade tactics will dominate the discussions between Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and his counterparts. Fran√ßois-Philippe Champagne, Canada‚Äôs finance minister, said at an opening news conference on Tuesday, noting that during recent meetings with American officials in Washington, ‚Äúthere was always tension around tariffs.‚Äù Mr. Bessent, who skipped a gathering of the Group of 20 finance ministers in February, will appear at the international forum for the first time. Mr. Bessent plans to make the case that countries need to get ‚Äúback to basics‚Äù and take steps to address ‚Äúimbalances and nonmarket practices,‚Äù according to a Treasury Department spokesman. Mr. Bessent is also expected to prioritize expressing the Trump administration‚Äôs concerns about China‚Äôs excess industrial capacity. The Group of 7 is made up of the United States, Canada, Britain, France, Germany, Italy and Japan. Mr. Trump has upended the global trading system with a blizzard of tariffs. He imposed a 10 percent universal tax on almost every trading partner, in addition to 25 percent tariffs on imported steel, aluminum, cars and car parts. He raised tariffs on China to a punishing 145 percent in April before reducing them to 30 percent this month. In April, Mr. Trump hit dozens of countries with ‚Äúreciprocal‚Äù tariffs before pausing those levies for 90 days. Mr. Bessent and other Trump officials have said the administration is working to strike deals by July 8 with 18 to 24 trading partners, including Argentina, Malaysia, Israel, Switzerland, India, Japan, Vietnam, South Korea and Thailand. The United States and the European Union have also been negotiating over trade terms. Mr. Bessent warned that higher tariffs could kick in if negotiations with those nations faltered during the 90-day pause. Mr. Bessent said on CNN on Sunday that the United States was focused on completing agreements with a short list of partners, and that other parts of the world, like Central America or Africa, could see their tariff rates set through regional deals instead. The U.S. and Chinese governments are also starting to communicate more frequently in an effort to make progress on their trade spats. Gene Seroka, the executive director at the Port of Los Angeles, who sits on a trade advisory council for the Trump administration, said at a news conference on Monday that the administration was working constructively toward framework deals. Mr. Trump had threatened the biggest levies since the Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act of 1930. At the Group of 7 meeting of finance ministers in Canada that year, France‚Äôs finance minister at the time, Bruno Le Maire, said the club had become the Group of 7 plus one, with the United States on the outskirts. Mr. Trump‚Äôs first-term Treasury secretary, Steven T. Mnuchin, was sent home from the gathering with a stern rebuke. In a joint statement that year, finance ministers from the European Union, Canada and Japan ‚Äúrequested that the United States secretary of the Treasury communicate their unanimous concern and disappointment.‚Äù Mr. Bessent maintained that the United States was not retreating from the global stage. Although Mr. Trump has demonstrated a willingness to walk back some of his trade measures, the scale and scope of the tariffs that he has already announced have dwarfed those from his first term. The dominance of the trade disputes could also overshadow many of the other matters that have been central to the Group of 7 meetings, like efforts to combat climate change, the rise of artificial intelligence and working together to address China‚Äôs manufacturing subsidies. It is not clear the officials will be able to reach consensus on a joint statement, or communiqu√©, when the meetings conclude on Thursday.

title: Ni√±o Becerra enciende las alarmas: ‚ÄúEn verano podemos llegar a una situaci√≥n Covid de paralizaci√≥n de la econom√≠a mundial‚Äù

Por cada d√≠a que las fronteras estadounidenses se mantengan cerradas a las exportaciones mexicanas de ganado vivo, se tendr√≠a un impacto de 3 millones de d√≥lares diarios para los exportadores mexicanos. 16 encuestados (37% de la muestra) esperan un crecimiento negativo. La presidenta nacional del IMEF, Gabriela Guti√©rrez, asegur√≥ que de aprobarse en el Congreso estadounidense la iniciativa para gravar en 5% el env√≠o de remesas, se ‚Äúreconfigurar√° el mercado de remesas que se ha desarrollado en Estados Unidos‚Äù. title: Trump administration denounces Colombia for joining China‚Äôs Belt and Road Initiative
content: Last Tuesday, May 13, Colombia‚Äôs President Gustavo Petro and other Latin American leaders met with Chinese President Xi Jinping during the IV Forum between the Community of Latin American and ...
resumen:
On May 13, Colombia‚Äôs President Gustavo Petro and other Latin American leaders met with Chinese President Xi Jinping during the IV Forum between the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC) and China in Beijing. Petro announced on May 14 on X/Twitter that Colombia had joined the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), China‚Äôs trillion-dollar infrastructure project. He stated the aim was to end the trade deficit with China, which amounts to 14 billion dollars a year, and in the medium term, to become a central node for artificial intelligence. Petro also announced on May 16 that Colombia had formally requested to join the New Development Bank (NDB), the multilateral development bank created by the BRICS.

The US Bureau of Western Hemisphere Affairs responded on May 15 on X/Twitter that ‚ÄúChinese investments in Colombia and the region jeopardize the safety and security of the region.‚Äù The US will strongly oppose projects by the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) and other international financial institutions to Chinese-controlled and state-owned enterprises in Colombia.

In 2000, China was Colombia‚Äôs 37th trading partner, with imports of around US$10 million. Today, China is Colombia‚Äôs second largest trading partner, with imports exceeding US$16 billion and direct investments growing from US$84 million in 2021 to US$266 million in 2022. Between 2008 and 2024, Colombian exports to China increased by 475 percent, reaching US$2.3 billion, while Chinese imports to Colombia reached US$14.7 billion in 2024. In 2025, China overtook the United States as the main source of Colombian imports.

President Xi Jinping pointed out at the IV CELAC-China Forum that the volume of trade between Latin America and Beijing exceeded US$500 billion last year. Xi called on Latin American governments to ‚Äúreject external interference and promote regional autonomy.‚Äù The Belt and Road Initiative already includes 22 of the 33 Latin American countries and has enabled the development of more than ‚Äú200 infrastructure projects, creating millions of jobs.‚Äù China has also signed ‚Äúfree trade agreements with countries such as Chile, Peru, Costa Rica, Ecuador and Nicaragua.‚Äù

Brazilian President Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva (Workers Party-PT) stated that Brazil and China will be unavoidable partners. Since 2009, the Asian giant has been Brazil‚Äôs main trading partner. He celebrated the announced Chinese investment of R$27 billion in Brazil. Lula advocated Latin American integration in partnership with China, including the ‚ÄúEast-West Railway Corridor.‚Äù

Lula, Petro and other Latin American leaders want to try to benefit from Trump‚Äôs trade war. Petro declared during his trip to China: ‚ÄúWe are asking the US government to hold the CELAC-US summit.‚Äù Lula‚Äôs Finance Minister Fernando Haddad traveled to the US during the CELAC-China Forum in search of investments in the technology sector.

title: M√©xico se est√° convirtiendo en una autocracia, pero a Trump no le importa
content: M√©xico se est√° deslizando silenciosamente hacia una democracia autoritaria o un autoritarismo camuflado y al gobierno de Trump no parece importarle.
resumen:
M√©xico se est√° convirtiendo en una autocracia, pero a Trump no le importa.
M√©xico se est√° deslizando silenciosamente hacia una democracia autoritaria o un autoritarismo camuflado y al gobierno de Trump no parece importarle.
La presidenta mexicana, Claudia Sheinbaum, le debe un gran favor al presidente Donald Trump: los ataques del presidente estadounidense contra M√©xico han hecho subir su popularidad en su pa√≠s, y han desviado la atenci√≥n de sus intentos de socavar las instituciones democr√°ticas y apoyar a las dictaduras de Cuba y Venezuela.
La popularidad de Sheinbaum se ha disparado al 80% o m√°s desde que Trump asumi√≥ el cargo y anunci√≥ sus aranceles masivos a los productos extranjeros, seg√∫n nuevas encuestas de El Financiero, Latinus y otras.
Los aranceles de Trump, su deseo de enviar tropas estadounidenses a M√©xico para combatir los c√°rteles de la droga y su decisi√≥n de renombrar el Golfo de M√©xico como ‚ÄúGolfo de Am√©rica‚Äù han eclipsado las cr√≠ticas a la reforma judicial de Sheinbaum, que seg√∫n sus cr√≠ticos est√° transformando M√©xico en una autocracia.
M√©xico extradita a 29 destacados narcos a EEUU para aplacar los aranceles de Trump: una operaci√≥n "sin precedentes".
Bajo la reforma judicial iniciada por el expresidente Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador (el predecesor y mentor pol√≠tico de Sheinbaum) y continuada por ella, los jueces mexicanos ser√°n elegidos por voto popular.
En la pr√°ctica permitir√° al partido del gobierno, Morena, seleccionar los candidatos a jueces, hacer que ganen, y controlar el Poder Judicial.
M√©xico depende del mercado estadounidense para el 83% de sus exportaciones.
Una de las pocas voces que ha logrado llamar la atenci√≥n p√∫blica sobre la erosi√≥n de las instituciones democr√°ticas es la del expresidente Ernesto Zedillo.
Zedillo advirti√≥ que la actual reforma judicial constituye un ‚Äúataque frontal‚Äù a la democracia.
Zedillo se√±al√≥ que el gobierno de Sheinbaum ya controla el Congreso, y que la captura del poder judicial le dar√≠a a la presidente ‚Äúpoderes absolutos‚Äù.
Zedillo sugiri√≥ que Sheinbaum le pida a su partido una pausa de dos a√±os para que la reforma judicial pueda debatirse adecuadamente.
El continuo apoyo de Sheinbaum y su partido gobernante a las dictaduras de Cuba y Venezuela.
El dictador socialista venezolano Nicol√°s Maduro.
El 1 de mayo, Carolina Rangel, la secretaria general del partido Morena, visit√≥ Cuba y firm√≥ un acuerdo de cooperaci√≥n con el Partido Comunista de la isla.
Rangel se reuni√≥ con el dictador cubano Miguel D√≠az-Canel y le transmiti√≥ el ‚Äúcari√±o y la solidaridad del pueblo de M√©xico‚Äù.
D√≠az-Canel expres√≥ su admiraci√≥n a Sheinbaum y le agradeci√≥ su ‚Äúapoyo a Cuba‚Äù.
En su discurso del 9 de abril ante la Comunidad de Estados Latinoamericanos y Caribe√±os (CELAC), en Honduras, Sheinbaum exigi√≥ el fin de las sanciones comerciales de Estados Unidos contra Cuba y Venezuela.
Sheinbaum omiti√≥ mencionar que Cuba no ha permitido elecciones libres en m√°s de seis d√©cadas, y que la dictadura venezolana ha robado las ultimas elecciones y ha asesinado a muchos manifestantes pac√≠ficos.
Sheinbaum defendi√≥ la llegada de m√©dicos cubanos a M√©xico.
La presidenta de M√©xico dio la luz verde para la entrega de 400.000 barriles de petr√≥leo a Cuba, calific√°ndola de asistencia ‚Äúhumanitaria‚Äù.
El gobierno de Trump ha criticado a M√©xico en varios temas, raramente acusa a M√©xico por sus v√≠nculos con Cuba.
Trump recientemente calific√≥ a Sheinbaum de ‚Äúuna mujer maravillosa‚Äù y afirm√≥ tener una ‚Äúmuy buena‚Äù relaci√≥n con ella.

resumen: El √çndice Mensual de Actividad Econ√≥mica (IMAE) en Honduras registr√≥ un crecimiento del 4,3 % entre enero y marzo de 2025, impulsado por el dinamismo de la demanda interna, el repunte de las exportaciones de caf√© y el flujo de remesas familiares, inform√≥ el Banco Central hondure√±o (BCH). El √çndice Mensual de Actividad Econ√≥mica (IMAE) se expandi√≥ un 7,88 % interanual a marzo pasado en Panam√°, impulsado por los sectores del transporte, almacenamiento y comunicaciones, el comercio y la manufactura, entre otros, seg√∫n datos del Instituto Nacional de Estad√≠stica y Censo (INEC) difundidos este martes.

title: Marco Rubio tilda de ‚Äúabsurdo‚Äù querer que se acepte a todos los migrantes en EE.UU. y deja recado a la reunificaci√≥n familiar
content: El alto cargo republicano subray√≥ la necesidad de establecer un proceso claro de selecci√≥n sobre qui√©nes deben ser admitidos y a qui√©nes se debe priorizar para entrar a EE.UU.
resumen: El secretario de Estado, Marco Rubio, calific√≥ este martes de ‚Äúabsurdo‚Äù pretender que se acepte la entrada de todos los migrantes que quieran vivir en Estados Unidos. Durante una comparecencia ante el Comit√© de Relaciones Exteriores del Senado, Rubio dejo entrever, incluso, que deber√≠a revisarse la prioridad que actualmente se otorga al criterio de la reunificaci√≥n familiar. Rubio afirm√≥ que la pol√≠tica de inmigraci√≥n debe basarse sobre el inter√©s nacional de Estados Unidos. A√±adi√≥ que si existiera un subconjunto de personas ‚Äúm√°s f√°ciles de verificar‚Äù y a ‚Äúquienes entendemos mejor‚Äù, estas podr√≠an tener alg√∫n tipo de preferencia. Rubio dijo que no se puede asumir a millones de personas en todo el mundo y que ning√∫n pa√≠s puede hacerlo. El alto cargo republicano subray√≥ la necesidad de establecer un proceso claro de selecci√≥n sobre qui√©nes deben ser admitidos y a qui√©nes se debe priorizar. Para Rubio, ‚Äúlo esencial‚Äù es aceptar que resulta ‚Äúabsurdo‚Äù pensar que cualquier persona tiene el derecho autom√°tico de emigrar a Estados Unidos. Rubio, defendi√≥ la actual pol√≠tica exterior del gobierno como una restauraci√≥n del liderazgo estadounidense. Rubio resalt√≥ una serie de medidas adoptadas para reforzar la seguridad y proteger los intereses del pa√≠s: Fortalecimiento de alianzas regionales con M√©xico, El Salvador y otros pa√≠ses para frenar la migraci√≥n ilegal y enfrentar organizaciones criminales como la MS-13. Revisi√≥n de visados y estatus migratorio para personas consideradas amenazas a la seguridad. Actuaciones diplom√°ticas decisivas para resolver conflictos, incluyendo un acuerdo de paz entre Ruanda y la Rep√∫blica Democr√°tica del Congo. Rubio tambi√©n destac√≥ el compromiso con una pol√≠tica comercial nacionalista. Uno de los pilares de su intervenci√≥n fue el endurecimiento de la postura hacia China, denunciando pr√°cticas abusivas y el tr√°fico de fentanilo. Asimismo, present√≥ una reorganizaci√≥n del Departamento de Estado: Introducci√≥n del Fondo de Oportunidades Am√©rica Primero (A1OF) de 2.900 millones de d√≥lares para responder con agilidad a crisis globales y promover objetivos estrat√©gicos. Eliminaci√≥n de programas ‚Äúideologizados‚Äù y reformas para concentrar los recursos en intereses diplom√°ticos concretos. Rubio, finalmente, critic√≥ con dureza el rumbo que tom√≥ el Departamento de Estado en la anterior Administraci√≥n. Marco Rubio asegura que bajo su liderazgo, el departamento contar√° con ‚Äúresponsabilidades claras y cadenas de mando‚Äù, destacando su compromiso con una diplomacia efectiva y alineada con los intereses nacionales.

title: Agentes del ICE a la caza de migrantes en restaurantes de Washington
content: El presidente Donald Trump, convencido de que Estados Unidos es v√≠ctima de una invasi√≥n de extranjeros, ha convertido la lucha contra la migraci√≥n ilegal en una de sus prioridades.

Agentes del ICE irrumpieron en Pupatella, una pizzer√≠a de Washington, en busca de empleados en situaci√≥n irregular, pero se fueron con las manos vac√≠as.

El presidente Donald Trump ha convertido la lucha contra la migraci√≥n ilegal en una de sus prioridades.

Agentes del Departamento de Seguridad Interior se presentaron primero en la sede de Dupont de Pupatella, sin orden judicial ni documentaci√≥n, y fueron rechazados.

Natasha Neely, vicepresidenta de los restaurantes Pupatella, no sabe por qu√© su restaurante, donde "todo el mundo tiene papeles", fue tomado como blanco.

Shawn Townsend, presidente de la Asociaci√≥n de Restaurantes de Washington (RAMW), afirm√≥ que los migrantes indocumentados son una parte fundamental de la industria y la columna vertebral.

RAMW organiz√≥ talleres sobre los documentos que los empresarios deben cubrir para certificar que una persona est√° autorizada a trabajar en Estados Unidos.

Un due√±o de un restaurante de la capital que recibi√≥ la visita de agentes del Departamento de Seguridad Interior hace dos semanas est√° preocupado y no puede dar algunos documentos que le pidieron.

Un estudio del bufete de abogados laboral Littler Mendelson PC indica que el 58% de los empresarios encuestados teme que las pol√≠ticas antimigratorias de Trump creen escasez de mano de obra.

Muchos empleados del due√±o del restaurante de Washington no acuden al trabajo por miedo a ser detenidos.

Shawn Townsend opina que el clima pol√≠tico y los desaf√≠os econ√≥micos contribuyen a los niveles de ansiedad de los trabajadores.

En las pizzer√≠as Pupatella no ha habido detenciones pero la irrupci√≥n de la polic√≠a caus√≥ impacto.

title: Trump‚Äôs trade war risks splintering the Internet, experts warn
content: Trump has responded to threats of digital services taxes with threats of more tariffs, arguing that "only America should be allowed to tax American firms," Reuters reported. Back in February, Trump ...
resumen:
Donald Trump's trade war risks splintering the Internet, experts warn. Experts have warned that the consequences for Silicon Valley could be far-reaching.

Allianz Trade shared results of a survey of 4,500 firms worldwide, designed "to capture the impact of the escalation of trade tensions." The group warned that the US's fixation on the country's trillion-dollar goods deficit risks rocking "the fastest-growing segment of global trade," America's "invisible exports" of financial and digital services. Recent estimates "reveal a large digital trade surplus of at least $600 billion for the US, spread across categories like digital advertising, video streaming, cloud platforms, and online payment services."

According to Allianz Trade, these "hidden" exports have "far" outpaced "the growth of goods exports over the past two decades, but because of how these services are delivered, "this trade goes uncounted in traditional statistics." If Trump doesn't "rethink trade policy and narratives" soon to start tracking all this trade more closely, he risks undermining this trade advantage‚Äîwhich Allianz Trade noted "is underpinned by America‚Äôs innovative firms and massive data infrastructure"‚Äîat a time when he's in trade talks with most of the world and could be leveraging that advantage.

"US digital exports now represent a significant share of world trade (about 3.6 percent of all global trade, and growing fast)," Allianz Trade reported. "These 'invisible' exports boost US trade revenues without filling any container ships, underscoring a new reality: routers and data centers are as strategically important as ports and factories in sustaining US leadership."

Without a pivot, Trump's current trade tactics could even threaten US dominance as "the world‚Äôs digital content and tech services hub," Allianz Trade suggested. US trade partners are already "looking into tariffs or taxes on digital services as a retaliation tool that could cause pain to the US," the report warned.

Jovan Kurbalija, a former diplomat and executive director of the DiploFoundation, warned in an April blog that this could have a "more profound impact" on the US than other retaliatory measures. "If the escalation of trade tensions moves into the digital realm, it could have far-reaching consequences for Silicon Valley giants and the digital economy worldwide," Kurbalija wrote.

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen confirmed to the Financial Times last month that she was proactively developing such countermeasures if Trump's trade talks with the European Union failed. Those measures could potentially include "a tax on digital advertising revenues that would hit tech groups such as Amazon, Google and Facebook," the FT reported. They may also include "tariffs on the services trade between the US and the EU."

Trump's aggressive tariffs on goods have handed "the EU and others both moral and tactical pretexts to fast-track digital taxes" as countermeasures, Kurbalija wrote. He's also given foreign governments an appealing narrative of "reclaiming revenue from foreign tech 'free riders,'" Kurbalija wrote, while perhaps accelerating the broader "use of digital service taxes as a diplomatic tool" to "pressure the US into balanced negotiations."

For tech companies, the taxes risk escalating trade tensions, potentially perpetuating the atmosphere of uncertainty that, Allianz Trade reported, has US firms scrambling to secure reliable, affordable supply chains.

Neal K. Shah, the CEO of CareYaya Health Technologies, warned that "tariffs on digital services would directly reduce revenues for American tech companies."

At the furthest extreme, the "digital trade war threatens to splinter the Internet‚Äôs integrated infrastructure," Kurbalija warned, fragmenting the Internet in a way that could "undermine decades of gradual development of technological interconnectedness."

Shah suggested that on top of increased hardware costs, tech companies also incurred costs of providing services for "parallel digital universes with incompatible standards." Users traveling to different locations might find that platforms have "different features, prices, and capabilities," he said.

"For startups and industry innovators," Shah predicted, "fragmentation means higher compliance costs, reduced market access, and slower growth." Such a world also risks ending "the era of globally scalable digital platforms," decreasing investor interest in tech, and reducing the global GDP "by up to 5 percent over the next decade as digital trade barriers multiply," Shah said. If digital services tariffs become a permanent fixture of global trade, Shah suggested that it could, in the long term, undermine American tech dominance, including in fields critical to national security, like artificial intelligence.

"Trump‚Äôs tariffs may dominate today‚Äôs headlines, but the silent war over digital services will define tomorrow‚Äôs economy," Kurbalija wrote.

Trump has responded to threats of digital services taxes with threats of more tariffs, arguing that "only America should be allowed to tax American firms," Reuters reported. In February, Trump issued a memo calling for research into the best responsive measures to counter threats of digital service taxes, including threatening more tariffs.

Allianz Trade's survey found that many US firms are instead rerouting supply chains through "emerging trade hubs" like Southeast Asia, the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, and Latin American countries where tariff rates are currently lower. 50 percent of US firms surveyed confirmed they are considering increasing investments in China, in response to the US abruptly shifting tariffs tactics. Only 8 percent said they‚Äôre considering decreasing Chinese investments.

Allianz Trade suggested that Trump may be stuck in the past with a trade strategy focused too much on goods at a time when the tech industry needs more modern tactics to keep America's edge in global markets.

"An economy adept at producing globally demanded services‚Äîfrom cloud software to financial engineering‚Äîis less reliant on physical supply chains and less vulnerable to commodity swings," Allianz Trade reported. "The US edge in digital and financial services is not just an anecdote in the trade ledger; it has become a structural advantage."

Bertin Martens, a senior fellow at a European economics-focused think tank called Bruegel, broke down in April how practical it could be for the EU to attack digital platforms. The EU could possibly use a law known as the Anti-Coercion Regulation to impose digital services tariffs.

"Platforms with substantive presence in the EU cannot be the target of trade measures" under that law, Martens noted. That could create a carveout for the biggest tech giants who have operations in the EU, Martens suggested, but only if those operations are deemed "substantive," a term that the law does not clearly define.

To make that determination, officials would need "detailed information on the locations or nationalities" of all the users that platforms bring together, including buyers, sellers, advertisers and other parties, Martens said.

Shah suggested that there could be one clear winner if Trump doesn't reprioritize shielding digital services exports in the way that experts recommend. "A surprising potential consequence of digital tariffs could be the accelerated development and adoption of open-source technologies," Shah wrote. "As proprietary digital products and services become subject to cross-border tariffs, open-source alternatives‚Äîwhich can be freely shared, modified, and distributed‚Äîmay gain significant advantages."

If costs get too high, Shah suggested that even tech giants might "increasingly turn to open-source solutions that can be locally deployed

title: M√©xico cae en el ranking global de startups al lugar 43
content: A pesar de que M√©xico brinda un ecosistema para las Startups con muchas ventajas, cay√≥ en el ‚ÄúGlobal Startup Ecosystem Index 2025‚Äù.
resumen: M√©xico cay√≥ dos escalones a la posici√≥n 43 dentro del ‚ÄúGlobal Startup Ecosystem Index 2025‚Äù, elaborado por la firma StartupBlink. A nivel regional el pa√≠s se mantiene en el cuarto lugar. La mayor√≠a de las ciudades mexicanas dentro del top 1,000 experimentaron un descenso en su clasificaci√≥n. La Ciudad de M√©xico descendi√≥ cinco posiciones, ubic√°ndose en el lugar 43 a nivel global, aunque mantiene su posici√≥n como la segunda ciudad mejor posicionada en Latinoam√©rica. Las tres principales ciudades del ecosistema mexicano muestran tasas de crecimiento por debajo del promedio nacional, donde Guadalajara destaca con registra un avance del 17%. Le√≥n presenta la mayor alza, con m√°s del 78%. M√©xico es uno de los mercados m√°s grandes de Latinoam√©rica, debido a una enorme poblaci√≥n que brinda a sus ecosistemas de startups una ventaja para escalar localmente. Goza de un acceso estrat√©gico tanto a los mercados de Norteam√©rica como de Sudam√©rica, por lo que ha sido cuna de algunas de las startups m√°s exitosas de la regi√≥n, incluyendo unicornios como Kavak, Clip, Bitso y Plata. Los cambios econ√≥micos globales han acelerado a√∫n m√°s este impulso, ya que la guerra comercial entre Estados Unidos y China, as√≠ como las disrupciones en las cadenas de suministro durante la pandemia, llevaron a muchas multinacionales a relocalizar sus instalaciones de producci√≥n y centros de ingenier√≠a a la Rep√∫blica Mexicana. M√©xico mantiene acceso preferencial al mercado estadounidense a trav√©s del T-MEC (USMCA), aunque algunos sectores ‚Äîcomo el automotriz y el del acero‚Äî siguen sujetos a aranceles adicionales. El pa√≠s ofrece a las startups diversas fuentes de financiamiento e infraestructura con bajos costos operativos y el sector p√∫blico impulsa el crecimiento del ecosistema emprendedor mediante varias iniciativas nacionales.

title: Trump blinked on tariffs and called it a win. But China trade deal is loss for US. | Opinion
content: Opponents, like China, are learning President Trump's negotiating style, which typically ends up with him backing down and simply declaring a win.
resumen:
David Sanger of The New York Times began an article about Donald Trump as follows: ‚ÄúAfter weeks of bluster and escalation, President Trump blinked. Then he blinked again. And again.‚Äù

Sanger wrote that opponents were learning Trump‚Äôs negotiating style, which he summarized as ‚Äúmaximalist, issuing a huge demand, creating a crisis and setting off a high-pressure negotiation. But increasingly often, he ends up backing down and simply declaring a win.‚Äù

President Trump has yet to achieve anything remotely approaching a trade-related win since returning to the White House. The best he has managed is to avoid the even greater losses that would have followed had he failed to blink.

‚ÄúLoss‚Äù is the only way to describe his decision last month to lower tariffs on all countries (except China) to 10% for a three-month period to allow negotiations. Previously the tariffs ranged from 39% on goods from the European Union to nearly 100% on goods from Southeast Asia.

By blinking, Trump ensured that the dollar‚Äôs status as a ‚Äúsafe-haven currency‚Äù was only threatened rather than completely lost.

‚ÄúLoss‚Äù is also the only way to describe Trump‚Äôs dropping the tariff on China from 145% to 30%. It represents a realization that Trump started a trade war ‚Äúthat China is infinitely better positioned to win.‚Äù China was already moving to shift exports to other countries and has access to countries other than America for goods it currently imports from America.

The Wall Street Journal editorial board pithily put it, ‚ÄúThe President started a trade war with Adam Smith. He lost.‚Äù

Companies are already warning that the tariffs will force them to raise the prices they charge consumers, and Mattel, Chlorox, and Denny‚Äôs recently reported that sales are already down as consumers reduce purchases in anticipation of those higher prices.

The Fed will be faced with the same Hobson‚Äôs choice it faced back in the late 1970s and early 1980s. If they lower interest rates to reduce the likelihood of a recession, they increase the likelihood of runaway inflation.

During his first term, Trump blamed the COVID-19 pandemic for wrecking the economy. This time around, he will have no one to blame but himself.

Michael K. Cantwell is Chair of the Communications Committee for the Palm Beach County Democratic Party. He lives in Delray Beach.

resumen: La Administraci√≥n de Donald Trump prorrogar√° dos meses la licencia de la estadounidense Chevron para operar en Venezuela. El asesor especial de Trump, Richard Grenell, prev√© verse en Antigua con enviados de la dictadura de Maduro. En su primer mandato, Trump elimin√≥ los permisos a las petroleras estadounidenses y amenaz√≥ con sanciones a las de otros pa√≠ses, incluida la espa√±ola Repsol. En esta segunda etapa, ha ordenado a las extranjeras salir de Venezuela, pero le sigue prorrogando los permisos a Chevron. La licencia actual de Chevron ten√≠a como fecha l√≠mite el 27 de mayo, tras una pr√≥rroga previa otorgada ya en marzo. El director ejecutivo de Chevron, Mike Wirth, ha dicho p√∫blicamente que un repliegue completo dejar√≠a un vac√≠o que ser√≠a ocupado de inmediato por compa√±√≠as petroleras de Rusia y China. El Tribunal Supremo de EE.UU. permiti√≥ la expulsi√≥n de 350.000 inmigrantes venezolanos acogidos a un programa de Biden conocido como Estatus de Protecci√≥n Temporal. Otros 250.000 podr√≠an ser deportados en septiembre. La pr√≥rroga de la licencia a Chevron llega tras la liberaci√≥n de un veterano de la Fuerza A√©rea de Estados Unidos, Joseph St. Clair, detenido en Venezuela desde noviembre. title: Israel‚Äôs Allies Condemn Expansion of Gaza War
content: Britain, France and Canada called the Israeli plans for escalation ‚Äúdisproportionate‚Äù and ‚Äúegregious‚Äù at a time when the U.N. is warning the population is at risk of famine.
resumen:
Israel‚Äôs threats to drastically escalate the war in Gaza and its blockade of humanitarian aid to a Palestinian population at risk of famine have drawn sharp condemnation from some powerful Western allies.

Britain said it was suspending talks with Israel on expanding a free-trade agreement. Britain, France and Canada issued a rare public reprimand of Israel, demanding it cease the renewed military offensive.

A joint statement by the three countries said: ‚ÄúWe have always supported Israel‚Äôs right to defend Israelis against terrorism. But this escalation is wholly disproportionate.‚Äù

Israel is threatening to take full control of Gaza and has been blocking humanitarian aid from Gaza for more than two months, even as the U.N. warns that the population is under threat of famine.

Israel said it would begin allowing some humanitarian aid to flow into Gaza. Authorities let only five trucks in on Monday.

A senior U.N. humanitarian official, Tom Fletcher, told the BBC on Tuesday that 14,000 babies in Gaza could die in the next 48 hours unless truckloads of aid could enter. He said thousands of trucks, some containing baby food, were ready to move in.

Britain, France and Canada called the expanded Israeli campaign against Hamas in Gaza and the withholding of aid ‚Äúegregious actions‚Äù that cannot continue.

The statement said: ‚ÄúIf Israel does not cease the renewed military offensive and lift its restrictions on humanitarian aid, we will take further concrete actions in response.‚Äù

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said Britain, France and Canada had handed a ‚Äúhuge prize‚Äù to Hamas. He accused them of tacitly encouraging a repeat of the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks, that killed some 1,200 people in Israel, with 250 taken as hostages to Gaza.

Mr. Netanyahu said: ‚ÄúThis is a war of civilization over barbarism. Israel will continue to defend itself by just means until total victory is achieved.‚Äù

Israel has killed more than 53,000 Palestinians in Gaza, according to Gazan health officials.

President Trump has increasingly bypassed Mr. Netanyahu, cutting a separate deal with Hamas to free the last living American hostage and skipping Israel on his trip to the Middle East last week.

Mr. Trump said ‚Äúa lot of people are starving‚Äù in Gaza under the Israeli blockade and the United States wanted to help alleviate the suffering.

Foreign Secretary David Lammy announced in Parliament the suspension of free-trade talks with Israel, condemning what he said were Mr. Netanyahu‚Äôs plans to ‚Äúdrive Gazans from their homes into a corner of the strip to the south and permit them a fraction of the aid that they need.‚Äù

European officials have privately expressed ‚Äúincreasing frustration and even anger with Israeli actions in Gaza.‚Äù

In March, Israel ended a two-month cease-fire with Hamas that would have freed the hostages in exchange for an end to the war and a full Israeli withdrawal. Mr. Netanyahu has said Israel could not accept anything less than for Hamas to disarm and its leaders to go into exile.

The United Nations said that the handful of trucks allowed through the Kerem Shalom Crossing were not enough amid a dire humanitarian situation in the Palestinian encalve.

Jean-No√´l Barrot, the French foreign minister, said the E.U. could decide to suspend its agreement with Israel unless the Gaza offensive were halted.

title: How Trump's budget bill & tax cuts would impact the US economy
content: As Congress considers President Trump's tax and budget plan, Citi economist Veronica Clark joins Market Domination to discuss what the bill becoming law would mean for the US economy. To watch more ...
resumen: Citi economist Veronica Clark discusses the impact of President Trump's tax bill on the US economy. The bill's impact on the deficit is expected to be flat, around 6% of GDP, which means a pretty flat impulse for growth. The debt servicing costs and interest expense will be an increasing part of the deficit. The tariff increase on China is around 30%, which could be passed on to consumer prices. The Fed's preferred inflation measure, core PCE inflation, is around 2.5% and could be closer to 3% by the end of the year. The consumer was weakening before the tariffs, and consumption could be slowing. Savings rates are very low, delinquencies are pretty high, and student loan repayments are starting soon. The Fed is effectively frozen for the near term, waiting for the next data point. The labor market may start to weaken before concerning signs of price increases. The unemployment rate has risen in the last couple of years due to a loosening labor market driven by very low hiring.

title: What if Trump ditches tariffs too quickly to see a real effect?
content: I hope Trump pushes forward on tariffs. Hear me out. He has already backtracked faster than a hiker who spies a rattlesnake. Trump spent the first weeks of his second term spitting out tariff rates in ...
resumen: Trump has backtracked on tariffs. On Feb. 1, he announced 25% tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada (along with a 10% tax on goods from China) and then reversed himself. On Feb. 3, he decided upon a 30-day pause on Canada/Mexico tariffs. Trump announced that the Mexico/Canada tariffs were suspended. This continued for several more weeks (a 200% tariff on Champagne and wine from the EU, 25% tax on cars and parts, a tariff on movies, carve-outs for various electronics, copper, lumber, etc.) culminating in ‚ÄúLiberation Day‚Äù on April 2, when Trump announced a national emergency to justify a suite of tariffs. After ‚ÄúLiberation Day,‚Äù the world reeled. The European Union, China and other nations announced retaliatory tariffs, and markets crashed. The obliteration of $8.5 trillion in wealth between April 2 and April 8 occurred. On April 9, he suspended the ‚ÄúLiberation Day‚Äù levies for 90 days ‚Äî though he tacked on an additional 145% tariff on China. On May 12, he climbed down even from those. The overall average effective tariff rate is 17.8% ‚Äî the highest since 1934. It was 2.5% when Trump took office in January.

title: General Motors stops exporting made-in-US vehicles to China amid ongoing trade tension
content: General Motors has decided to stop exporting cars from the United States to China, as tensions rise between Washington and Beijing over trade. The move comes shortly after a temporary truce in the ...
resumen: General Motors has decided to stop exporting cars from the United States to China, as tensions rise between Washington and Beijing over trade. The move comes shortly after a temporary truce in the trade war between the two countries, which saw both sides agree to reduce tariffs for 90 days. US-based automotive giant General Motors informed its employees and dealers in China on Thursday that it will cease exporting cars from the United States to China. GM had been exporting cars to China through its Durant Guild premium import business, which accounted for less than 0.1 per cent of its total sales in the country, according to a company spokesperson. The spokesperson said they are restructuring The Durant Guild and streamlining GM China√¢¬Ä¬ôs operations due to significant changes in economic conditions. Previously, goods imported from the US to China faced tariffs of over 100 per cent, until both countries agreed to temporarily reduce them for 90 days. In April, GM√¢¬Ä¬ôs rival Ford also halted its exports to China. As part of the agreement, both countries decided to cut tariffs for 90 days. US tariffs on Chinese goods dropped from 145 per cent to 30 per cent, while Chinese tariffs on US goods fell from 125 per cent to 10 per cent.

title: Tariffs live updates: China iPhone exports to US plunge to 14-year low amid tariff tensions
content: On Tuesday, it was reported that Chinese shipments of Apple's iPhone and mobile devices to the US fell to their lowest since 2011 in April. The sharp drop highlights how US tariff ...
resumen: Chinese shipments of Apple's (AAPL) iPhone and mobile devices to the US fell to their lowest since 2011 in April. The Port of Los Angeles saw shipments drop by as much as 30% in early May. Importers and retailers, especially those linked to China, were among the most affected. Port of Los Angeles Executive Director Gene Seroka said Monday that the impact was felt almost immediately during that first week of May. JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon said Monday that markets are underestimating the long-term impact of tariffs, calling the current duties ‚Äúpretty extreme.‚Äù He flagged rising risks of inflation and stagflation. Citigroup‚Äôs (C) Jane Fraser noted companies are delaying investments amid tariff uncertainty. Walmart (WMT) previewed coming price hikes. Trump told the company to "eat the tariffs.". Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Sunday that tariff rates will go back to "reciprocal" levels if countries do not make trade deals with the US during the 90-day pause. The US is prioritizing trade deals with 18 key partners. Trump said Friday that the US will set tariff rates for its trading partners within the next few weeks. Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic suggested that businesses may be exhausting the strategies they can use to avoid price or employment changes. Former Medtronic CEO Bill George said that the world's CEOs welcome signs of progress on US trade deals. George, who has sat on the boards of Target (TGT), ExxonMobil (XOM), and Goldman Sachs (GS), said he's telling CEOs to be ready to deploy capital once more trade clarity emerges. The 90-day trade truce between China and the US appears to have done little to ease Beijing‚Äôs tight control over its rare earth exports. China‚Äôs pledge to suspend or remove the ‚Äúnon-tariff‚Äù countermeasures imposed on the US since April 2. US trade representative Jamieson Greer said that the Chinese have agreed to remove those countermeasures. Walmart said that the tariffs would lead to price hikes. Trump encouraged them to "eat the tariffs." Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent relayed that he had spoken to Walmart CEO Doug McMillon ‚Äî and that McMillon had told him that the company "will be absorbing" some of the costs. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt claimed that Trump has "always maintained" that "Chinese producers" will absorb tariff costs. The European Commission has warned that tariff uncertainty is pushing euro-area inflation below the European Central Bank‚Äôs target for next year.

title: China Demonstrates High Cost Of Trumpian Uncertainty
content: Not big moves, but symbolic ones as U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs trade war takes an increasing toll on Chinese confidence. So far, Trump‚Äôs tariffs haven‚Äôt tackled Asia‚Äôs biggest economy in the ways ...
resumen: China's 5.4% growth rate in the first three months of the year is impressive. The People‚Äôs Bank of China cut its key lending rates by 10 basis points. Governor Pan Gongsheng lowered the one-year loan prime rate to 3.0% from 3.1%, and the five-year rate to 3.5% from 3.6%. U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs trade war is taking an increasing toll on Chinese confidence. China grew above its 5% target in the first quarter while the U.S. shrank 0.3%. Data releases showed signs of the high cost of economic uncertainty. Softening data on retail sales, fixed asset investment, property prices, industrial production and other sectors are showing a chilling effect. Trump has pared his 145% China tax to 30%. This climbdown could be short-lived if Chinese leader Xi Jinping doesn‚Äôt offer Trump concessions. Trump‚Äôs 30% level puts the tax in the neighborhood of the 1930s Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act. Prior to January 20, China was struggling with a giant property crisis that‚Äôs fueling deflation, near-record youth unemployment, a rapidly aging population and local governments dealing with trillions of dollars of debt. Factory-gate prices have been falling for 31 consecutive months. In April alone, producer prices dropped 2.7% year on year. Consumer prices are now down for three straight months. The PBOC‚Äôs rate cut was its first since October, when it moved by 25 basis points. Fears that the yuan might fall too far, too fast had Pan avoiding rate cuts. "Today's reductions ... probably won't be the last this year," says Zichun Huang, China economist at Capital Economics. The rate cuts will reduce interest payments on existing loans, taking some pressure off indebted firms. It will also reduce the price of new loans. Modest rate cuts alone are unlikely to boost loan demand or wider economic activity meaningfully. "We still believe it will be quite challenging for Beijing to achieve its 'around 5%' growth target unless it rolls out a sizable stimulus package," says Ting Lu, chief China economist at Nomura. A 30% tariff on all shipments to the globe‚Äôs biggest economy is no joke. Economic uncertainty comes at a very high price.

title: China's smartphone exports to US hit decade low since 2011 amid tariff tensions
content: According to the report, smartphone shipments from China to the US dropped 72% year-on-year to just under $700 million last month. This steep fall far exceeded the overall 21% decline in Chinese ...
resumen: Smartphone exports from China to the US dropped 72% year-on-year to just under $700 million last month. This steep fall far exceeded the overall 21% decline in Chinese exports to the US during the same period. Chinese exports of Apple Inc.‚Äôs iPhones and other mobile devices to the United States fell to their lowest level in over a decade in April. The looming threat of US tariffs has disrupted the flow of high-value electronics between the two countries. The Trump administration‚Äôs tariff strategy √¢¬Ä¬î with levies reaching as high as 145% on Chinese imports √¢¬Ä¬î is severely impacting technology supply chains and shifting electronics production to other countries. Beijing has accused Washington of derailing recent negotiations in Geneva by pursuing additional sanctions targeting Huawei Technologies Co.√¢¬Ä¬ôs AI chip business. In 2024, smartphones, laptops, and lithium-ion batteries ranked among the top US imports from Beijing, while China imported valuable commodities such as soybeans, oil, and semiconductor manufacturing machinery from the US. Chinese exports of phone components to India rose, with volumes roughly quadrupling over the past year. Apple has its largest iPhone production base outside China in India. Former President Trump recently criticized the move and urged the company to bring production back to the US.
